text: It is quality rather than quantity that matters.
author: Seneca

text: Life, if well lived, is long enough.
author: Seneca

text: Another person will not hurt you without your cooperation. You are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be.
author: Epictetus

text: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: If someone is able to show me that what I think or do is not right, I will happily change, for I seek the truth, by which no one was ever truly harmed. It is the person who continues in his self-deception and ignorance who is harmed.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Without an ever-present sense of death, life is insipid.
author: Muriel Spark

text: There is wonder all around us, but we are ephemeral.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: 100 percent of us die.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: Keep a clear eye toward life’s end.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: You may not wake up tomorrow… You may not sleep again.
author: Seneca

text: The one who puts the finishing touches on their life each day is never short of time.
author: Seneca

text: Let us prepare our minds as if we’d come to the very end of life. Let us postpone nothing. Let us balance life’s books each day.
author: Seneca

text: Let each thing you would do, say, or intend be like that of a dying person.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love…
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Keep death and exile before your eyes each day, along with everything that seems terrible. By doing so, you’ll never have a base thought nor will you have excessive desire.
author: Epictetus

text: Death, when it approaches, ought not to take one by surprise. It should be part of the full expectancy of life.
author: Muriel Spark

text: We all appear to ourselves frustrated in our old age… because we cling to everything so much.
author: Muriel Spark

text: O gentlemen, the time of life is short! To spend that shortness basely were too long, If life did ride upon a dial’s point, Still ending at the arrival of an hour.
author: William Shakespeare, Henry IV, Act 5, Scene 2

text: It seems to me that everything passes so quickly that we should be thinking more about how to die than how to live.
author: Teresa of Avila

text: Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand – and melting like a snowflake.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Memento Mori – remember death! These are important words. If we kept in mind that we will soon inevitably die, our lives would be completely different.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Every soul will taste death, and you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection. So he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has attained [his desire]. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.
author: Surah Al-Imran: 185

text: Did you then think that We had created you without purpose and that you would never be returned to Us?
author: Surah Al-Mu’minun: 115

text: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as a trial, and to Us you will be returned.
author: Surah Al-Anbiya’:35

text: Death will surely come, if not today, then tomorrow.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
